result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel T Sajdak was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: To commence immediately.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

records.addlTxt:
1:39 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Julia Westley.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with probation and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Westley concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Westley.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-6 months county jail, with huber.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-$1000 fine plus court costs.
-Blood Draw Fee $ 42.50
-DL revocation for 36 months
-IID - 36 months
-AODA & any follow-up (Milwaukee)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Sheriff's Department.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:54 p.m.
from Atty Julia Westley dated September 28, 2016 - requests an adjournment
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:04 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Julia Westley present via telephone.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Westley - received an offer and would like time to discuss it.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 18, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:06 p.m.
from Attorney Westley to Judge Slate dated July 26, 2016. Requests to appear by phone for 08/30/2016 hearing. (ORIGINAL)
From Attorney Westley to Judge Slate dated July 26, 2016. Requests to appear by phone for 08/30/2016 hearing. Approved. (FAX COPY)
Status hearing on August 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

11:27 a.m .  No appearance by the defendant or Atty Julis Westby.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets for Mandatory appearance for bothe defendant and attorney on August 30, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:28 a.m.
State's
Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:10 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Julia Westley.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Westley - defendant will waive the prelim today.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Westley and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Westley enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.  Atty Westley can appear via telephone.

Court adjourned at 11:13 a.m.
By Atty Julia C. Westley
Status hearing on June 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on May 24, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.

2:35 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 24, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:37 p.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
